channel.title: Bypassing GameGuard?
channel.description:
[i]I'm playing a pretty fun game and I decided hey why not take advantage of the hotkeys to train my account? I got bored of living my life in a while loop, pressing TAB then F then waiting for the mob to die.[/i]
I've created a c# program that sends these keys using SendKeys.SendWait("{TAB}"); and SendKeys.SendWait("f"); but the problem is gameguard terminates the program when I try to use it on the protected application.
I even tried using two computers and teamviewer. Running my .net application as spectator view and having the game on the main view. It failed to let me access the game screen lol.
So I thought about hmm.. it must be the API calls since it is a .net program. However I've googled around and it seems even C++ would be blocked. I'm not so sure about C I haven't tried it yet. My question is is there any programming language gameguard hasn't protected itself from yet? Excluding autoit(mem hog), & vb.net(ugly&newbs).
I was thinking java and using the robot class or even deploying python. I'm not really sure but before I try what do you guys think about java and python sending the TAB key to the game? Is there anyway, besides modding a gadget to tap my keyboard, to send keys to the game?
[size=3pt]See you guys in a few hours going to bed, super tired. [/size]

item.title: Bypassing GameGuard?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Well Gameguard updates itself on load, and replaces the exe, so hacking it on its own is useless.

What you could try do is set the exe to read only, or if you have kaspersky set it to protected so that it can not be modified, i think its called safe mode. However to do this you would need to hack the exe and inject a DLL after to allow your own applications to run. Unfortunately I haven’t actually done this since i used to play Gunbound back when I was a child.

Have a look at this: http://www.descipe.net/forum/soldier-front/5770-how-bypass-gameguard.html

Read full topic

@Innovation wrote:

I’m playing a pretty fun game and I decided hey why not take advantage of the hotkeys to train my account? I got bored of living my life in a while loop, pressing TAB then F then waiting for the mob to die.

I’ve created a c# program that sends these keys using SendKeys.SendWait("{TAB}"); and SendKeys.SendWait(“f”); but the problem is gameguard terminates the program when I try to use it on the protected application.

I even tried using two computers and teamviewer. Running my .net application as spectator view and having the game on the main view. It failed to let me access the game screen lol.

So I thought about hmm… it must be the API calls since it is a .net program. However I’ve googled around and it seems even C++ would be blocked. I’m not so sure about C I haven’t tried it yet.
